paper_abstract: We employ a recently formulated axisymmetric version of the multiphase Shan-Chen (SC) lattice Boltzmann method (LBM) [S. Srivastava et al., Phys. Rev. E 88, 013309 (2013)] to simulate the contraction of a liquid ligament. We compare the axisymmetric LBM simulation against the slender jet (SJ) approximation model [T. Driessen and R. Jeurissen, Int. J. Comput. Fluid Dyn. 25, 333 (2011)]. We compare the retraction dynamics of the tail-end of the liquid ligament from the LBM simulation, the SJ model, Flow3D simulations and a simple model based on the force balance (FB). We find good agreement between the theoretical prediction FB, the SJ model and the LBM simulations.
paper_title: LATTICE BOLTZMANN METHOD TO STUDY THE CONTRACTION OF A VISCOUS LIGAMENT
